meanings.sent1: She whipped the eggs until they were fluffy.
meanings.sent2: The chef whipped the cream to make a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent3: The baker whipped the batter with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The storm whipped the trees, bending them in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The coach whipped the team into shape for the big game.

meanings.sent1: The team was whipped in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: They were whipped by their opponents in the final round.
meanings.sent3: After the debate, he felt whipped but proud of his effort.
meanings.sent4: The candidate was whipped in the election, losing by a landslide.
meanings.sent5: The students were whipped in the spelling bee, but they learned a lot.

meanings.definition: Having a consistency like whipped cream
meanings.sent1: She made a delicious pie with whipped cream on top.
meanings.sent2: The cake was decorated with a layer of whipped frosting.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy clouds in the sky looked like whipped cream.
meanings.sent4: The snow on the mountain had a whipped texture after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a picture of a whipped dessert with precision.
